definition: to receive mail/to receive a telegraph
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: You mean you want to have them sent with charges to be collected from the addressee?
sentences.chinese: 你是说你想拍发这些电报并让收报人付费？

sentences.english: As to the receiver and manipulator, they were very simple.
sentences.chinese: 至于收报机和发报机，制造起来非常简单。

sentences.english: The ticker tape machine began to throw out tape.
sentences.chinese: 自动收报机已开始工作。

sentences.english: The date of completion is the date of acceptance statement by the Parties.
sentences.chinese: 竣工日期为双方在验收报告上签字的日期。

sentences.english: After finishing final acceptance, the buyer offer final acceptance report.
sentences.chinese: 验收后甲方提供验收报告。

sentences.english: Eg. Mrs Hobbs was caught short when the newspaper boy came for his money a day early.
sentences.chinese: 报童提早一天来收报费，霍布斯太太的钱不够交付。

sentences.english: Shall we present you the acceptance report tomorrow?
sentences.chinese: 验收报告明天可以给你吗？

definition: (of a stock on the stock market) to close at (a certain price)
NASDAQ/National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations, a computerized data system to provide brokers with price quotations for securities traded over the counter
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
Hang Seng index (of Hong Kong stock market)
Dow Jones Industrial Average (abbr. for 道瓊斯指數|道琼斯指数[Dao4 Qiong2 si1 Zhi3 shu4])

pinyin: Shang4 zheng4 zong1 he2 zhi3 shu4

definition: devastating setback/slump (in stock market etc)/crushing defeat/to cause a serious setback/to plummet
to regurgitate/(fig.) (of a stock market) to give up (gains)
stock market index/share price index/abbr. for 股票指數|股票指数[gu3 piao4 zhi3 shu4]
